title: Old School RuneScape Mobile

properties.name: description
properties.value: Old School RuneScape Mobile is an Old School RuneScape client for the Android and iOS mobile platforms. It was announced on 17 July 2017 and was released on 30 October 2018. It allows players to play Old School RuneScape for free on their Android and iOS mobile devices[1]. It works cross-platform with the desktop client, allowing players to play using the same accounts.[2]

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:RuneScape Mobile
Old School RuneScape Mobile
Developer Jagex
Publisher Jagex
Engine RuneTek
Release dates 30 October 2018
Genre Fantasy MMORPG
Ratings • 16 by PEGI
• MA15+ by ACB
• Not rated by ESRB
Platforms iOS, Android
Requirements
  • iOS 10.0 or later
  • Android 5.0 or later
Input Touch screen
Website https://oldschool.runescape.com

Old School RuneScape Mobile is an Old School RuneScape client for the Android and iOS mobile platforms. It was announced on 17 July 2017 and was released on 30 October 2018. It allows players to play Old School RuneScape for free on their Android and iOS mobile devices[1]. It works cross-platform with the desktop client, allowing players to play using the same accounts.[2]

Old School RuneScape is rated 16 by the Pan European Game Information committee,[3] and MA15+ by the Australian Classification Board[4]. While Old School RuneScape is not rated by the Entertainment Software Rating Board, the equivalent rating would be Teen.

On 24 November 2021 a closed Android beta ran until 8 December 2021. This beta was for initial feedback on testing features introduced in the Steam Client that will eventually be rolled out on the mobile version; this closed beta was in preparation for an open beta that launched in 28 February 2022,[5] with a closed beta rolling out for iOS in April 2022 afterwards.[6]

Contents

  • 1 Features
    • 1.1 Interface
    • 1.2 Spellbook
  • 2 Settings
    • 2.1 Display
    • 2.2 Controls
      • 2.2.1 Function mode
  • 3 Troubleshooting
    • 3.1 Installation Issues
      • 3.1.1 Unable to launch app
    • 3.2 Connection Issues
      • 3.2.1 Error! Your login or password was incorrect. Please try again.
      • 3.2.2 Unable to connect
  • 4 Pre-launch
  • 5 Gallery
  • 6 Changes
  • 7 References

Features[edit | edit source]

The mobile client has suspend and resume support which will keep players logged in but idle (for as long as they would be in the desktop client) if the player switches to another app, e.g to take a phone call; however, this may vary between the type of phone the player uses. Additionally, players who log in to the mobile client once will be able to login subsequently through the same device without the need to enter their username and password. This active session can be disabled by tapping Log Out in the Main Menu or through the player's Account Settings.

Interface[edit | edit source]

The interface displays some features that are exclusive to the mobile client.

Function Use
Internet connection This displays a mobile phone or Wi-fi icon to denote whether the game is played through a mobile data or Wi-fi connection.
Battery This displays the mobile device's battery level (in 4 blocks of 25%). Players may tap on the battery icon which will display the exact level for 3 ticks. If the phone is plugged into a charger, a charging () icon will appear over the battery icon.

Spellbook[edit | edit source]

The spellbook interface on the mobile client, having filtered Utility spells.

Players on the mobile client may check the level and runes required to cast a spell by tapping the Info button on the bottom of the spellbook interface, then tapping the desired spell.

If players use enough filters to significantly decrease the number of spells displayed, the spell icons will become enlarged to make them easier to tap.

Settings[edit | edit source]

Main article: Settings

There are several settings that are exclusive to the mobile client, in addition to those that already exist on the desktop client.

Display[edit | edit source]

This menu is for graphical settings. It contains a slider and several toggle buttons. It does not contain the Resizable screen and Advanced Options interface, and is replaced by other options.

Function Use
Camera zoom distance This is a slider that can be adjusted to zoom within the game. Players can also tap the button to disable the use of two fingers to zoom.
Limit Framerate This is a slider that can adjust the frames-per-second (FPS) that the mobile client can display. It can be set to 15, 20, 30 and Max (60). Players cautious with battery consumption are recommended to set their FPS low.
Allow tapping through the chatbox This allows players to choose whether they can tap through their chatbox or not.
Store orb This allows players to choose whether the store orb is displayed on the minimap or not. For free-to-play players, it is enabled by default.

Controls[edit | edit source]

This menu is for adjusting how the game is controlled. Mouse options and keybinds are not displayed in the mobile client.

Function Use
Single-tap mode Single-tap mode acts as the desktop's right-click. If players disable Single-tap mode, they must touch & hold in order for "right-click" options to appear on an object.
Tap to drop items Tap to drop acts as the desktop's shift-click drop. If enabled, the inventory interface will be highlighted red, and tapping an item will drop it instantly.
Show the function button The function button enables a small button to appear directly above the Combat Options tab on the mobile client.
Deadzone adjuster Adjusts how far sidebar buttons are away from the edge of the device's screen.

Function mode[edit | edit source]

If the function button is enabled, it will appear directly above the Combat Options tab. Once tapped, a chatbox will appear, prompting players to select a function mode:

Function Use
Keyboard If selected, tapping it will cause the mobile keyboard to appear.
Tap-to-drop If selected, tapping it will cause the inventory interface to be highlighted red, and tapping an item will drop it instantly.
Single-tap If selected, tapping an object acts as the desktop's right-click. If players change the function or disable Single-tap mode via the Controls interface, they must touch & hold in order for "right-click" options to appear on an object.

Troubleshooting[edit | edit source]

Installation Issues[edit | edit source]

Unable to launch app[edit | edit source]

  • Review that you're mobile device meets the current Game Requirements.
  • Re-install the app.
  • If you're using a mobile emulator, make sure you're using the latest version of the mobile emulator and Old School RuneScape Mobile app.

Connection Issues[edit | edit source]

Error! Your login or password was incorrect. Please try again.[edit | edit source]

  • A bug confirmed in late 2020 which affected some devices generated an empty space when typing the first character of an account's email/username. This bug should already be patched on most, if not all, devices; but a simple work-around is to delete any spaces before your email/username after typing it in order to save your login credentials.

Unable to connect[edit | edit source]

  • Toggling airplane mode on and off is a quick way to reconnect your mobile device to the nearest cell tower. This will also toggle on and off your mobile device's Wi-Fi. But if that doesn't seem to help, try restarting your mobile device.
  • If you're still unable to connect to the game with or without Wi-Fi enabled, try connecting to a world server from Google Chrome instead of by launching the game from the Old School RuneScape Mobile app.

Pre-launch[edit | edit source]

At RuneFest 2017, players had the chance to play Old School RuneScape Mobile on the live servers.

Players were able to sign up to express their interest in joining closed tests. Selection for participation was based on account standing and device type.

The original planned release for Old School RuneScape Mobile was in winter 2017 but was delayed. A technical beta involving 2,000 players ran from 2 February 2018 to 8 February 2018. A second beta involving 5,431 players ran from 13 April 2018 to 19 April 2018.

An open beta test for Android was released on 5 July 2018, via an app available on the Google Play store. Although free to download, only players with a members subscription were be able to sign in and play. An open beta for iOS was released later in Summer 2018.[7]

Gallery[edit | edit source]

  • The login screen on iOS.

  • The default interface.

  • Moving and interacting with an item.

  • The mobile icon during Christmas 2018.

  • The mobile icon during the release of Song of the Elves.

  • The mobile icon during the Mobile Anniversary event.

  • The mobile icon during the release of The Nightmare.

  • The mobile icon commemorating the release of Sins of the Father.

  • The mobile icon commemorating the release of Trailblazer League.

  • The mobile icon commemorating the game's 8th birthday.

  • The mobile icon commemorating the release of Group Ironman Mode.

  • The mobile icon commemorating the release of Shattered Relics League.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
12 January 2022
(update) 		Mobile

An Account Deletion button has been added in the Account Management tab, under the Useful Links section.

17 November 2021
(update) 		Mobile

Fixed an issue where the word ‘null’ was appearing in shop menus for mobile users.

26 March 2020
(update) 		Mobile

The Bond store is now available once more on iOS devices.

27 February 2020
(update) 		Mobile

The following changes have been made:

  • Accounts created through mobile can once again be linked to an email address.
  • Tapping a player's username in the chatbox now opens the keyboard instead of the text line.
20 February 2020
(update) 		Mobile

The following changes have been made:

  • Mobile devices which don't use the slider which controls how far apart the interfaces are will no longer have that slider.
  • Wiki link has been re-enabled for iOS users.
13 February 2020
(update) 		Mobile

Players may no longer redeem bonds for membership on iOS devices if they already have an active membership.

5 December 2019
(update) 		Mobile

The following changes have been made:

  • The tap-to-drop option for mobile users will be toggled off if the player logs out for more than a few minutes, so that players are less likely to drop their stuff by mistake when they return.
  • Links to Old School websites in the Account Management tabs and on the welcome screen are no longer displayed when playing on iOS devices
2 October 2019
(update) 		Mobile

A new slider on the options side-panel now adjusts the minimum dead-zone at the side of your screen. Shifting the side-stones will shift in real time. This setting will be remembered after logout and persist for each account that logs into the same device.

15 July 2019
(update) 		Mobile

The following changes have been made:

  • Fixed PvP world login warning.
  • Added clearer disconnect reason messaging.
6 June 2019
(update) 		Mobile

The following changes have been made:

  • Free players tapping on a members skill on the stats interface should no longer randomly stop you performing skilling actions.
  • The mobile app's icon that shows the app to be using mobile data rather than wifi has been changed. The previous picture of a smartphone () was unclear, whereas the new icon is a more standard design and is consistent with the wifi indicator.
24 January 2019
(update) 		Mobile

The following changes have been made:

  • The Pest Control shop interface has had its black background removed, since it wasn’t rendering well on Mobile devices. As part of this, the buttons have been made more responsive.
  • The world switcher layout has been restructured to make sort buttons stay visible as the interface scrolls and increased size of the sorting buttons on mobile.
  • The Pyramid Plunder overlay is now positioned in the top left making it less obstructive.
  • The Wintertodt Boss next game countdown timer no longer displays when a game has started, this occurred when backgrounding the app on iOS and returning as the next round starts.
  • The Prayer tab now has an info button which when activated displays tooltip information on tap.
  • The Store orb no longer overlaps the Castle Wars timer.
17 January 2019
(update) 		Mobile

The following changes have been made:

  • The chatbox interface no longer obstructs cutscenes during Making History and Swan Song.
  • Deleting text on the Report Abuse interface after closing the keyboard now works as expected.
  • The area left of the XP counter now registers taps when the counter is disabled.
  • Tutor icons in the newcomer map can now be toggled on and off correctly on mobile.
  • A flash effect in a cutscene from Another Slice of H.A.M. has been fixed.
22 November 2018
(update) 		Mobile

The Store orb on mobile has been shifted slightly to reduce its overlapping.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Mod Sween. "Old School Mobile FAQ." 17-Jul-2017 14:05:49. Old School RuneScape General Forums.
  2. ^ Jagex. "Old School Mobile". 17 July 2017. Old School RuneScape News.
  3. ^ Pan European Game Information. (Archived from the original on 13 May 2022.)*
  4. ^ Australia Classification Board. (Archived from the original on 13 May 2022.)*
  5. ^ Jagex. "Known Issues - New Android Client Open Beta". 28 February 2022. (Archived from the original.) Old School RuneScape News.
  6. ^ Jagex. "iOS Closed Beta & Inventory Rework". 20 April 2022. (Archived from the original.) Old School RuneScape News.
  7. ^ Jagex. "OSRS Mobile: Android Members Beta". 5 July 2018. (Archived from the original.) Old School RuneScape News.

{{*}} ''Not rated by ESRB'' }} '''''Old School RuneScape Mobile''''' is an ''[[Old School RuneScape]]'' client for the {{wp|Android (operating system)|Android}} and {{wp|iOS}} mobile platforms. It was announced on [[17 July]] [[2017]] and was released on [[30 October]] [[2018]]. It allows players to play ''Old School RuneScape'' for free on their Android and iOS mobile devices{{CiteForum |author=Mod Sween |url=http://archive.fo/cKsSC |title= Old School Mobile FAQ|forum= Old School RuneScape General|postdate=17-Jul-2017 14:05:49|accessdate=13:40, July 17, 2017 (UTC) |notes= |name= }}. It works cross-platform with the desktop client, allowing players to play using the same [[accounts]].{{CiteNews|url=http://services.runescape.com/m=news/old-school-mobile?oldschool=1|title=Old School Mobile|newsdate=17 July 2017}} ''Old School RuneScape'' is rated '''16''' by the {{wp|Pan European Game Information}} committee,{{CiteGeneral|url=https://pegi.info/search-pegi?q=runescape&op=Search&age%5B%5D=&descriptor%5B%5D=&publisher=Jagex+Ltd&platform%5B%5D=&release_year%5B%5D=&page=1&form_build_id=form-5Nc7D2ScBDuiMzP9F2ffxljtiSLFY38thQpDSDwRrq0&form_id=pegi_search_form|title=Pan European Game Information|accessdate=13 January 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/eXLLQ|archivedate=13 May 2022}} and '''MA15+''' by the {{wp|Australian Classification Board}}{{CiteGeneral|url=https://www.classification.gov.au/titles/old-school-runescape|title=Australia Classification Board|accessdate=13 January 2022|archiveurl=https://archive.ph/3NdIz|archivedate=13 May 2022}}. While ''Old School RuneScape'' is not rated by the {{wp|Entertainment Software Rating Board}}, the equivalent rating would be '''Teen'''. On [[24 November]] [[2021]] a closed Android beta ran until [[8 December]] [[2021]]. This beta was for initial feedback on testing features introduced in the [[Steam Client]] that will eventually be rolled out on the mobile version; this closed beta was in preparation for an open beta that launched in [[28 February]] [[2022]],{{CiteNews|title=Known Issues - New Android Client Open Beta |newsdate=28 February 2022 |url=https://secure.runescape.com/m=news/known-issues---new-android-client-open-beta-?oldschool=1}} with a closed beta rolling out for iOS in April 2022 afterwards.{{CiteNews|title=iOS Closed Beta & Inventory Rework |newsdate=20 April 2022|url=https://secure.runescape.com/m=news/ios-closed-beta--inventory-rework?oldschool=1}} ==Features== The mobile client has suspend and resume support which will keep players logged in but idle (for as long as they would be in the desktop client) if the player switches to another app, e.g to take a phone call; however, this may vary between the type of phone the player uses. Additionally, players who log in to the mobile client once will be able to login subsequently through the same device without the need to enter their username and password. This active session can be disabled by tapping Log Out in the Main Menu or through the player's Account Settings. ===Interface=== The interface displays some features that are exclusive to the mobile client. {| class="wikitable" !colspan=2|Function !Use |- |[[File:Mobile data usage.png|center]] [[File:Wifi usage.png|center]] |Internet connection |This displays a mobile phone or Wi-fi icon to denote whether the game is played through a mobile data or Wi-fi connection. |- |[[File:Mobile battery.gif|center]] |Battery |This displays the mobile device's battery level (in 4 blocks of 25%). Players may tap on the battery icon which will display the exact level for 3 ticks. If the phone is plugged into a charger, a charging ([[File:Phone charging.png]]) icon will appear over the battery icon. |} ===Spellbook=== [[File:Mobile spellbook filtering.png|thumb|220px|The spellbook interface on the mobile client, having filtered Utility spells.]] Players on the mobile client may check the level and runes required to cast a spell by tapping the Info button on the bottom of the spellbook interface, then tapping the desired spell. If players use enough filters to significantly decrease the number of spells displayed, the spell icons will become enlarged to make them easier to tap. ==Settings== {{main|Settings}} There are several [[settings]] that are exclusive to the mobile client, in addition to those that already exist on the desktop client. ===Display=== [[File:Display (mobile).png|left]] This menu is for graphical settings. It contains a slider and several toggle buttons. It does not contain the Resizable screen and Advanced Options interface, and is replaced by other options. {{clear|left}} {| class="wikitable" !colspan=2|Function !Use |- |[[File:Mobile zooming.png]] |Camera zoom distance |This is a slider that can be adjusted to zoom within the game. Players can also tap the button to disable the use of two fingers to zoom. |- |[[File:Adjust Frames Per Second.png]] |Limit Framerate |This is a slider that can adjust the frames-per-second (FPS) that the mobile client can display. It can be set to 15, 20, 30 and Max (60). Players cautious with battery consumption are recommended to set their FPS low. |- |[[File:Tap through chatbox.png]] |Allow tapping through the chatbox |This allows players to choose whether they can tap through their chatbox or not. |- |[[File:Toggle store orb.png]] |Store orb |This allows players to choose whether the [[Minimap#Store_orb|store orb]] is displayed on the [[minimap]] or not. For [[free-to-play]] players, it is enabled by default. |} ===Controls=== This menu is for adjusting how the game is controlled. Mouse options and keybinds are not displayed in the mobile client. {{clear|left}} {| class="wikitable" !colspan=2|Function !Use |- |[[File:Single-tap mode.png]] |Single-tap mode |Single-tap mode acts as the desktop's right-click. If players disable Single-tap mode, they must touch & hold in order for "right-click" options to appear on an object. |- |[[File:Tap to drop.png]] |Tap to drop items |Tap to drop acts as the desktop's shift-click drop. If enabled, the inventory interface will be highlighted red, and tapping an item will drop it instantly. |- |[[File:Function button.png]] |Show the function button |The function button enables a small button to appear directly above the [[Combat Options]] tab on the mobile client. |- |[[File:Deadzone adjuster.png]] |Deadzone adjuster |Adjusts how far sidebar buttons are away from the edge of the device's screen. |} ====Function mode==== [[File:Set Function.png|left]] If the function button is enabled, it will appear directly above the [[Combat Options]] tab. Once tapped, a chatbox will appear, prompting players to select a function mode: {{clear|left}} {| class="wikitable" !colspan=2|Function !Use |- |[[File:Show Keyboard.png]] |Keyboard |If selected, tapping it will cause the mobile keyboard to appear. |- |[[File:Tap-to-drop mode.png]] |Tap-to-drop |If selected, tapping it will cause the inventory interface to be highlighted red, and tapping an item will drop it instantly. |- |[[File:Single-tap mode (Set Function).png]] |Single-tap |If selected, tapping an object acts as the desktop's right-click. If players change the function or disable Single-tap mode via the Controls interface, they must touch & hold in order for "right-click" options to appear on an object. |} ==Troubleshooting== ===Installation Issues=== ====Unable to launch app==== * Review that you're mobile device meets the current [[Game Requirements]]. * Re-install the app. * If you're using a mobile emulator, make sure you're using the latest version of the mobile emulator and ''Old School RuneScape Mobile'' app. ===Connection Issues=== ====Error! Your login or password was incorrect. Please try again.==== * A bug confirmed in late 2020 which affected some devices generated an empty space when typing the first character of an [[account]]'s email/username. This bug should already be patched on most, if not all, devices; but a simple work-around is to delete any spaces before your email/username after typing it in order to save your login credentials. ====Unable to connect==== * Toggling {{WP|airplane mode}} on and off is a quick way to reconnect your mobile device to the nearest cell tower. This will also toggle on and off your mobile device's Wi-Fi. But if that doesn't seem to help, try restarting your mobile device. * If you're still unable to connect to the game with or without Wi-Fi enabled, try connecting to a [http://oldschool.runescape.com/slu world server] from {{WP|Google Chrome}} instead of by launching the game from the ''Old School RuneScape Mobile'' app. ==Pre-launch== At {{RSL|RuneFest 2017|RuneFest 2017}}, players had the chance to play ''Old School RuneScape Mobile'' on the live servers. Players were able to sign up to express their interest in joining closed tests. Selection for participation was based on account standing and device type. The original planned release for ''Old School RuneScape Mobile'' was in winter 2017 but was delayed. A technical beta involving 2,000 players ran from [[2 February]] [[2018]] to [[8 February]] [[2018]]. A second beta involving 5,431 players ran from [[13 April]] [[2018]] to [[19 April]] [[2018]]. An open beta test for Android was released on [[5 July]] [[2018]], via an app available on the Google Play store. Although free to download, only players with a [[members]] subscription were be able to sign in and play. An open beta for iOS was released later in Summer 2018.{{CiteNews|url=http://services.runescape.com/m=news/osrs-mobile-android-members-beta?oldschool=1|title=OSRS Mobile: Android Members Beta|newsdate=5 July 2018}} ==Gallery== Old School RuneScape Mobile - Login screen.png|The login screen on iOS.
